comment: So far one of the best professors at Kennesaw State University highly recommend taking him because he's  a good professor and enjoyed his class. He answers all the emails and his class has 5 project through solid work, One final exam,three quizzes and one project at the end. Trust when I say take him please take him!!

Very clear about expectations. Assignments are mostly following along as he walks you through precisely how to do the assignment. Watch the videos, pay attention, and do exactly as instructed; you'll walk out with a near perfect score.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: I took this as a hybrid in-person/online class. Professor Como is exceptionally knowledgeable in his field. As with many EDG profs, he is very particular with grading but is very fair. He is more than happy to answer questions and if you make an effort, he will notice. He gives VERY specific feedback on assignments. I would HIGHLY recommend him.

Take his online EDG 1211 class if you can. It was awesome. He posts videos on how to do all the projects plus solution guides. You just have to follow along and copy it. I was able to work ahead on the projects and ended up finishing the course 2 months early. Super cool and chill guy. Take him!

Easiest choice for EDG 1211. He posts videos of him doing the assignments and you follow along. That's literally it. A little picky if you don't do things exactly like him, but you'll learn his grading style quickly. Quizzes are super easy and have 2 attempts. No tests. Final is another follow the video. Do not take Todd Young, crazy final project.

Class was Online. The material covered is straightforward and easy to understand. Lectures/walkthroughs were clear and to the point. Class gets easier on with more familiarity in Solidworks. Every assignment in the class was preparation for the CSWA exam which is the Final for the class. Highly recommend for Graphics II
Literally the easiest Graphics professor at this university. You have at most one part to create a week. And he has videos that explain in detail how to make the parts and drawings perfect.

I took him this semester as an online class, you'll learn a lot and it'll be pretty easy. He opens up all of his assignments and quizzes at the beginning so you can take them whenever you want. Is a fair grader and gives good feedback. Considering an EDG minor because of him.

This professor provides detailed step-by-step videos on how to complete the projects - SUPER HELPFUL! Not much time needed to study material. Not test heavy. Very approachable and made it interesting! Easy A as long as you keep up with assignments and read the test material (which is very brief). I would take his classes again anytime!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Como is awesome! Dont think about it and just take him. Tests and homework covers what he taught in lectures. Lots of real world experience and you learn a lot from them. Ask a question and he will cover and review it. Be prepared, expects you to review what he went over. Fast paced if you behind. Set up time for homework and dont miss class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes--Amazing lectures

comment: Mr. Como was a great professor for Graphics 2. Pros- His lectures were fast paced, informative and he gives lots of real world examples which made the class more interesting. Cons- no posted schedule and limited office hours. Come to class, listen, complete the assignments on time and you will have no trouble with this class.

Mr. Como is an amazing professor! Very knowledgeable and takes great interest in the success of every student. He also tries very hard to get to know every student and goes out of his way to help them. He shares a lot of industry experience in his lectures making them very interesting. Lectures are fast paced, fun and informative. Take him!
Lots of hw but he has answer keys to help guide you through arts. very knowledgeable and if you pay attention in class then youll do fine
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria

comment: Como loves what he is doing and you can tell it in how he teaches. He does a great job preparing you to take the CSWA and he does a great job at doing even going as far as taking the test himself in previous years and showing you what actual test questions would look like. He is a tough grader on the drawings you submit but he gives feedback.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Participation matters

comment: Lectures are fast paced & informative, be sure to pay attention. He expects you to be on your game. Assignments are fair & he goes over them in class, gives you plenty of time to do them. Quizzes were open book & straightforward. We had a large Mid-term & Final project. Hes a great person to learn from & knows a lot about the design industry.

Prof. Como is amazing. He has a lot of industry experience and really wants us to do well in his class to do well in the industry. Class itself was a good amount of work, but he's always there to answer any questions and responds to emails fairly quick. Highly recommend!

Best piece of advise given by Como, "If I could, I would change this class to a 6 hour class. You deserve more credit for the amount of work you do. We do the same amount of work as physics II and calculus II combined". It isn't easy, but you have the opportunity to get certified in Solidworks near the end. A bit picky in terms of drawing decorum

Prof. Como is great. The class is not hard at all but it has a pretty decent workload. He is very clear on what he wants & he also has videos that walk you through all of the assignments. He has open book quizzes that help boost your grade. Make sure for final & midterm you really know how to do everything & have your skills down, they're tough.
Awesome professor. Would take any of his classes again. Really takes the time to get to know his students.

HUGE work load for anyone but EVERY HOUR SPENT doing his assignments are worth their value. I am now a Certified Solidworks Associate because of his efforts throughout the semester. Warning, you can NOT do his assignments the night before. I tried. Group projects are fun, but choose your partner wisely. He worked for Lockheed on the F22,hes awesome

Finals are tough during finals his attitude make the classroom nervous and panic. In a way if you drew before you'll do great, but if you have never draw this class will take a lot of your time. Assign reading 3 weeks ago then changing the quiz date for 3 weeks. Grading criteria not clear, depends on his moods for your grade

Provides podcasts for assignments (via iTunes) Goes quickly but may allow time to catch up Make sure you have money to print (10 cents a page) Occasional quizzes Thoroughly covers material Book and kit needed  Does not take attendance (you understand it more by going) Know how to do each part (without major help) and you'll be fine
The best EDG 1212 professor by far. He takes the time to explain new concepts clearly and really knows his stuff.

I had Como for 1212 and knew he was a great professor. I had so much fun in a class! The field trips to industry locations were awesome! Also, I never have had a professor so willing to go the extra mile for me and be so interested in my success like Como did! Totally glad I took this class and met this professor and would take anything he teaches!

I took his hybrid class and he has had no problem over-bearing us the last month of class. Good professor at the start, but just alright after the midterm due mostly to his attitude. He also has a bad habit of changing the due date on things randomly, but only considers the first one he gives out.
Knows his stuff. Lots of industry experience. Your mechanical design abilities will grow leaps and bounds with Mr. Como. BEST 1212 professor by far.

You will learn a lot. You will also do a lot of work. He gives you everything you need to succeed. There is no excuse to not do well in his class if you legitimately put in the time and effort. I would recommend him to anyone.

WOW is all I can say! I had no idea how little I new about mechanical design until I took Como's 1212 class. This guy is amazing & knows his stuff. From Aerospace to Robotic Vehicles to Roadway he's done it all. He really cares if you do well but is no pushover. You will have to work very hard but will soar to places you only dreamed of. TAKE HIM!

Great Professor who really knows his stuff. Lots of aerospace experience which he relates to the class material very well. Yes the class requires a lot of homework but this engineering, not liberal arts. HIGHLY recommend taking him!!!!!!!

He has a somewhat abrasive personality, don't take him if that bugs you. But he really does care about his students. If you ask for help, he won't do it for you, he'll show you how to figure it out for yourself. One of the best professors I've had at SPSU.

Great teacher. Was always willing to help with subject matter I found difficult. There is a lot of homework, but it is necessary to really learn Graphics. Very fair grading as he tells you what he's looking for and adheres to it. Work hard and be prepared to spend many nights working on drawings. SolidWorks is fun!

Professor is a nice man. but dont take this class unless you have hours and hours of free time to do his homework. Never had so much homework in my life. He is also very critical of every mistake you make, would recommend taking another professor. He will call you out in front of other classmates and make you feel stupid. AVOID!

He is a very average professor. I thought his 'quizes' were an absolute way to flunk those who don't read his assigned reading. Overall, a good teacher. But at times he gets on your nerves. Oh yea, he gives a LOT of homework. HAVE FUN! :)

I cannot say enough about this teacher. He is fantastic. I had no idea what graphic design even was before taking the class. He is what ever teacher should be. Challenging, interesting, helpful, consistent, and fun! A very amazing class.
This guy is GREAT! i love this class, it made me want to take the next engineering design graphics class. Really recommend him if you can take him!!!
He's a great professor! Take him if you can. You'll learn a lot..  very helpful.
Great professor very knowledgeable. he is willing to work with any student and offer many aids such as podcast for each assignment.
Solid proffessor who enjoys the material and enjoys teaching. Was a fun class and I learned a lot

This guy rocks. No seriously. Not only was his class fun with just enough challenge to keep your attention, but he also plays in a band (and he's not to bad at that either). If you think there is even the slightest chance you might need or could use a class in engineering graphics take this guy.

Mr. Como was one of the best teachers I have ever had. He pushes you to succeed and at times it may seem like a lot to get done but if you pay attention to class and fallow the podcast you really shouldn't have any problem at all. He is strict but rightfully so.  All in all I would never take a different teacher for Graphics.

Mr. Como is a great graphics teacher. He is one of those teachers where if you try and show that your are trying to improve, he'll help you out any way possible. I would highly recommend Mr. Como for any class.
Mr. Como is the best professor. He uses itune to help the students follow step by step to sketch the drawing.
Great instructor; knows his subject matter very well.  Makes great use of technology and class time.  Would definitely recommend Prof. Como for any class.
Excellent teacher.  Made the subject material very easy to learn, but pushed us far enough.
Excellent Professor.  Relies very little on the book but still gets all the information crammed into you!  Worked very well with us and was available through email at any time.
Great Prof. Enjoyed taking his class and learned a lot of useful stuff. Would Recommend anyone to his classes. I really like the pod casts to help with homework.
A philantrophe, plus he love his job.

This professor did a great job. He taught everything clearly and simply. He was very helpful to all the students. He's very knowledgeable about his trade. I took him for engineering graphics I and learned alot from him. His class isn't that hard. He posts podcasts on the internet showing you everything step-by-step. Easy class.

Great professor. At the beginning, he presented himself as being very difficult, but as the semester went on, it turned out not to be as treacherous as he made it sound. He teaches a well-organized class and the assignments are clear. I thoroughly enjoyed the class.

Great teacher!  I would take him again.  Very clear on what he wants.  Make sure you print in his room (somehow he can tell if you don't(I thought I could get away with it too)).  If you don't get a good grade it is 100% your fault.

Great teacher who is interesting to talk to and has a life other than teaching. He knows how the industry works and has no problem giving tips and pointers to those willing to listen. The class is very easy, he guides you through it. As long as you do your work and be respectful you will be alright.

Mr. Como is a great professor. It is obvious he  enjoys what he does, and he cares how you do as well. He is very particular, but the trait is innate to the class. I learned a great deal of material and enjoyed it too. Complete ALL homework assignments and attend class regularly and this class will be in your best interest.

Como is a great teacher. He shows you how to do the drawing and models and if you miss the explanation he has podcasts. He keeps the class interesting by telling a joke every now and then. He is fair on the grading but dont be supprised is there is a -.1 on something, just human error. Take him if you can!

Como is a great teacher. He shows you how to do the drawing and models and if you miss the explanation he has podcasts. He keeps the class interesting by telling a joke every now and then. He is fair on the grading but dont be supprised is there is a -.1 on something, just human error. Take him if you can!
Everything good thats already been said is completely true. Great teacher and very helpful. Get him.
Everything good thats already been said is completely true. Great teacher and very helpful. Get him.
Everything good thats already been said is completely true. Great teacher and very helpful. Get him.

Como is a great teacher. He shows you how to do the drawing and models and if you miss the explanation he has podcasts. He keeps the class interesting by telling a joke every now and then. He is fair on the grading but dont be supprised is there is a -.1 on something, just human error. Take him if you can!

One of the better teachers I have come across. He doesn't demand too much from his students. Just that you keep up with the work he gives you which is not at all overwhelming. A very easy professor to approach for help and will work with you if your schedule doesn't work with his office hours.Go to class, do the work, ask for help if needed, & pass

Over all Mr. Como was very helpful with any issues on drawings both during class and during office hours. He was very meticulous in the grading but it is to be expected, he shows you how to do one of the two drawings that is due each class. overall the class was very easy if you actually take the time to correctly do the drawing.

Como is an awesome teacher! He can go off on tangents at times but all of his seemingly random stories all relate back to class. He provides you with everything you need to succeed in class and has podcasts in case you missed something (Great Idea!). If you get the chance to take hime, DO IT!
Great professor, he's tough but fair, makes it clear what is required of you.  Podcasts are extremely helpful, please keep it up.
I took Prof. Como's 1211 EDG Graphics 1 class and have to say he is one of the best teachers I've had at SPSU.  He is always prepared for class and has a very structured curriculum.

Easily my favorite professor at SPSU. Extremely well spoken. Very thorough with every detail. I loved how he based all his curriculum through modern day industry. Recommend him for every graphics student.
HORRIBLE! THINKS HE IS ALL THAT! TAKES STUFF TOO SERIOUSLY! DONT TAKE HIM! DOESNT DESERVE A JOB

Great professor with lots of industry experience. He is kind of new to teaching, but is doing a great job transitioning. Make sure you turn your assignments in on time! Had random pop quizzes from book, so make sure you bring your book every day. Really cool guy and great to work with, but not a slacker. Good preparation for a real job.

Fantastic teacher. Makes sure assignments are turned in before class, much like real-world job tasks can't be late. Tons of engineering experience through his career. Really helps you to know what to expect once you graduate and get an engineering job.

Awesome teacher. He is new to teaching but he has alot of knowledge on the subject matter. Grades fairly and podcasts are extremely helpful. Very nice guy though he likes to talk about himself. Would highly recommend.

Highly knowledgeable about the subject matter, decent at teaching it. He is relatively new at teaching, and could use a little more experience, but he seems to be improving. Teaches clearly and grades fairly. I had some trouble with the hand-drawing portion of the class, but once we got into SolidWorks it was pretty easy.

eh, compared to the rest of the edg teachers he is not as good. he likes to talk about himself alot which is wastes alot of class time. and his new at teaching so expect all immaturity that comes with that..but he does do podcasts which make it easy to if u just want a grade
Does podcasts for most assignments.  If you do poorly in this class it is 100% your fault.
Does very well at teaching. He also knows the subject very well. He also has a great personality and is very entertaining. Very good quality overall
Very Good Teacher, but a stickler for attendance AND promptness.  Homework is turned in AT THE BEGINNING OF CLASS... (when he walks in) and is considered late otherwise!
